>From: "Hollywood Narrator" <hollywood.narrator@...>
>Reply-To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
>To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
>Subject: Re: nWo base
>Date: Sun, 2 Feb 2003 07:26:41 -0500
>
>OOC: My pathetic post. Don't mind me, I just wanted to show I'm alive.
>
>BIC:
>
>Deemos approaches and watches silently, somehow looking both proud and 
>upset simultaneously. The reason for this was unknown, but Deemos had 
>always been a disturbed robot anyway. Spider walks up and appears very 
>excited. Arrow is nowhere in sight.
>
>Spider: I just hope I can be great enough one day for this team. As great 
>as I am, that task may be impossible.
>
>Deemos: I sacrificed my honor and became a traitor, and there was no 
>turning back. I paid my dues through hard work and became a leader of a 
>small ill fated faction and I'm still not great. I don't think you know 
>what greatness is.
>
>His sight never strayed from Phoenix while speaking to Spider.
>
>Spider: Yeah... Yeah.
>
>The furious Spider tries to pretend Deemos doesn't exist for a moment. He 
>tries to hide his resentment of what Deemos said, but is unable. He appears 
>really immature, but he was a young bot and very arrogant...
>
>   ----- Original Message -----
>   From: cardhead649 <cardhead649@...>
>   To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
>   Sent: Sunday, February 02, 2003 7:14 AM
>   Subject: Re: nWo base
>
>
>   Phoenix::
>
>   The femme shudders, but doesn't try to escape, knowing she can't
>   overpower Wolfenstein.  She's been on the wrong end of several forms
>   of 'entertainment' involving female prisoners, and being branded is
>   the least of her fears at the moment.
>
>   --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> wrote:
>   >
>   > : : Razor : :
>   > Razor: We welcome all to the New World Order. You will have to
>   change you color scheme and faction insignia's. Then we can all share
>   a few drinks.
>   > Razor's attention moves to the femme, causing him to smile.
>   > Razor: And we need to secure the prisoner. I'm sure that we can
>   find ways to entertain ourselves with her around. Come on in.
>   > He turns to walk back into the base with the nWo following. He
>   turns to Hollywood.
>   > Razor: Get the branding torch, it's time....
>   > The preceding has been paid for by the
>   > New World Order
>   >  "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
>   Phoenix::
>   >
>   > Join them.  It seems so easy, and yet, something holds Phoenix
>   back -
>   > Flicker.  Every time she thinks of him, she remembers what she and
>   so
>   > many others owe him.  Phoenix realizes she can't betray the
>   > Predacons, if only for the debt she owes that one Pred.
>   >
>   > The femme remains silent, waiting for a response from these
>   > mysterious black-and-white bots.
>   >
>   > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...>
>   wrote:
>   > >
>   > > : : Wolfenstein : :
>   > > Wolfenstein smiles at how easily the Predacon femme had
>   > surrendered. However he wasn't completely happy with himself. He
>   > could show ruthless aggression if necissary but he was a honorable
>   > warrior. This femme seemed so innocent, he almost felt bad about
>   > doing this too her.
>   > > He losens his grip around her neck a bit, so she wont be choked,
>   > but still keeping a good hold on her.
>   > > Wolfenstein(in a whisper to Phoenix): Dont try to fight out of
>   the
>   > situation. I honestly dont want to hurt you. Just go along with it,
>   > maybe even join us.
>   > > Wolfenstein(to all): So what about it? Will you let us join the
>   > brotherhood?
>   > >  "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
>   > Phoenix::
>   > >
>   > > The femme was already scared; Skulletron's and Wolfenstein's
>   > actions
>   > > don't help any.  For all the hell she went through at the hands

>   > > the Rogues, she is still innocent in many ways, and betrayal is
>   an
>   > > alien concept to her.  Knowing little about Hydras or Megatron,
>   she
>   > > is unaffected by Skulletron's arguement.  However, she knows
>   she's
>   > in
>   > > a tight squeeze.
>   > >
>   > > "Flicker ..." she whispers so low even Wolfenstein would barely
>   be
>   > > able to hear her.  "What would you do?"  Somewhere in the back of
>   > her
>   > > mind, a memory thought long deleted comes to the surface.  She
>   sees
>   > > once again the horror of the Rogues' attack on the defenseless
>   > > convent she had once called home.  She sees Flicker stand up to
>   > them,
>   > > despite being hopelessly overmatched.  In desperation, she had
>   > > surrendered herself to protect him and her people.  Now, it seems
>   > to
>   > > her to be the only route open once again.
>   > >
>   > > "I ... I surrender ..." she says aloud, her voice choked from
>   more
>   > > than just the wolf-bot's arm.
>   > >
>   > > OOC: Do what you will, just don't try to kill her - she has a
>   > mutant
>   > > spark that can't be destroyed.
